Orthopaedics & Joint Replacement

Comprehensive orthopaedic and joint replacement care with advanced surgical techniques in Ranchi.

Overview

The Department of Orthopaedics & Joint Replacement at Raj Hospitals provides expert treatment for musculoskeletal conditions including joint pain, trauma, sports injuries, and deformities. Our specialised surgeons perform minimally invasive surgeries, joint replacements, arthroscopy, and complex trauma management using latest technology for optimal patient outcomes and speedy recovery. We also offer pediatric orthopaedics and comprehensive rehabilitation services.

Why Choose Our Orthopaedics Department

  • Expert team of orthopaedic surgeons and physiotherapists
  • Advanced joint replacement technology
  • Minimally invasive surgical techniques
  • Comprehensive trauma and rehabilitation care

Key Facilities

State-of-the-art operation theatres
Advanced joint replacement technology
Comprehensive rehabilitation and physiotherapy
Dedicated pediatric orthopaedic care
Multidisciplinary orthopedic team
24/7 Emergency trauma care

Treatments We Offer

Advanced orthopaedic procedures and personalized care for all musculoskeletal conditions

Spine Osteoporosis

Comprehensive diagnosis and treatment for spine osteoporosis to prevent fractures and maintain bone strength.

Arthritis

Expert care and advanced therapies for arthritis to reduce pain, improve joint function, and enhance quality of life.

Joint Replacements

Advanced joint replacement surgeries for Knee, Hip, Shoulder, Elbow & Ankle ensuring mobility and pain relief.

Bone Deformity & CTEV

Surgical correction of bone deformities including clubfoot (CTEV).

Trauma Surgery

Emergency trauma management and specialized geriatric orthopaedic care.

Complex Trauma

Comprehensive care for severe trauma and ligament reconstructions like ACL, PCL.

Arthroscopy & Sports Injury

Minimally invasive procedures and expert care for sports-related injuries.

Paediatric Orthopaedics

Specialized treatment for children including deformity corrections and injury management.

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about Orthopaedic conditions and treatments

How long does recovery take after joint replacement?

Recovery varies per individual but generally patients regain mobility and return to daily activities within 6-12 weeks.

Are minimally invasive techniques used?

Yes, minimally invasive surgeries including arthroscopy and laparoscopic approaches are frequently used for better outcomes.

Do you provide pediatric orthopaedic care?

Yes, we specialize in pediatric cases including deformity correction and injury management.

Is pain managed effectively post-surgery?

Dedicated pain management protocols ensure patient comfort and promote fast recovery.

Have More Questions?

Get in touch with our Orthopaedic specialists

Our team will respond within 24 hours
